entries.meaning: A devil or demon; a malignant or diabolical being; an evil spirit.

examples: Religion teaches us to love everybody, be one fiend or friend.

entries.meaning: (religious, archaic) The enemy of mankind, specifically, the Devil; Satan.
examples: At the confirmation ceremony the bishop would lay his hands on the child and tie around its forehead a linen band  [â€¦] . This was believed to strengthen him against the assaults of the fiend  [â€¦]
He's been a jazz fiend since his teenage years.

verbs.description: fiend (third-person singular simple present fiends, present participle fiending, simple past and past participle fiended)

entries.meaning: (slang, intransitive) To yearn; to be desperate (for something).
examples: I play it off, but I'm dreaming of you / And I'll try to keep my cool, but I'm fiendin'
